form.name: form1

td.a: High School is recipient of 2019 Momentum Award
2018 U.S. News & World Report Ranks WHS
2017 Division V State Football Champions Recognized

span.div: Ahoy! If your family is interested in attending the Wheelersburg Schools now is the time to act. Open Enrollment Applications for kindergarten through 12th grade students for the 2020-2021 school year are now being accepted. Follow the link below and return a completed application to P.O. Box 340, Wheelersburg, Ohio 45694; or email to OpenEnrollment@Wheelersburg.net
Click here for your open enrollment application!
Beginning Monday, March 30 student meals will be delivered on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Follow the link below for locations and times.
Students and parents please review the information below regarding the District’s open enrollment program.
span.p: 1) The Open Enrollment forms for currently enrolled and returning students for the 2020-2021 school year should be returned by March 31.
2) The Open Enrollment informational meeting for new families wishing to enroll children in the Wheelersburg Schools scheduled for Thursday, March 26 has been cancelled.
3) New applications for the 2020-2021 school year will be accepted beginning on Monday, March 30. A link to the new application will be made available on Monday, March 30 on the District’s website.
5) Parents are encouraged to email their questions to OpenEnrollment@Wheelersburg.net .

span.span: The Wheelersburg Alumni Banquet is scheduled for July 25, 2020. This year's banquet is hosted by the Wheelersburg High School Class of 1970. See the
page for full details and registration information.

div.a: State Board of Education Recognizes WHS

span.div: Wheelersburg High School has been recognized by the State Board of Education and the Ohio Department of Education as a recipient of the 2019 Momentum Award. The Momentum Award recognizes schools for exceeding expectations in student growth for the year. Schools must earn straight A’s on all Value-Added measures on the report card. The school or district must have at least two Value-Added subgroups of students, which includes gifted, lowest 20% in achievement, and students with disabilities.

Wheelersburg High School Principal Chris Porter stated, “There are a total of 48 districts and 173 schools recognized this year. This is another example of the hard work and attention to detail that our teachers, students and staff are putting in on a daily basis. It is also confirmation that our teachers and staff are focusing on the right improvement practices. Thank you to everyone for helping make this award a reality for our school. Congratulations!”
For additional information follow this link to the Ohio Department of Education’s website.

div.span: Important: Use OneView to update Student Information

span.div:
Reminder to Parents -- Use the online Oneview Program to update your address and phone number changes.
Also, please use the OneView system to update your child's health records. Have you taken your child to their physician lately? Were prescriptions changed for your child? If yes, update their records on OneView.

This way the school will always have the most current information concerning your child. This is important.
Lastly, please remember to update your free and reduced lunch application or apply for free and reduced lunches if your income has changed or the number in your household has changed.
For more information, call 740-574-2527 or 740-574-8130 and ask for the guidance department.
Bus Routes for the current school year are posted.

br.span: The calendar for the 2019-20 school year has been adopted. The calendar for state testing is being finalized and will be posted soon.
School supply lists have been posted for the 2019-20 school year. http://www.wheelersburg.net/supplylists7026.aspx

Parents needing to enroll a new student for the 19-20 school year can now begin the enrollment process online. You will still need to bring in required paperwork, but you can save time by completing the enrollment form online. Our new registration system is called OneView. Go to the Registration page, read and follow the instructions to create your account and enter the requested information.
Please sign-up for the Alumni database.
